intro: Plesioneuron deficiens, commonly known as the deficient plesioneuron, is a rare and lesser-known species of liverwort. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, leafy structure and unique reproductive features. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rocky crevices or forest floors. Its morphology includes a thalloid body with distinct lobes and specialized structures for spore production. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is of interest to botanists studying cryptogamic flora.
